intro: Anemone brevistyla, commonly known as the short-styled anemone, is a herbaceous perennial native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 inches and features delicate, white to pale pink flowers with a distinctive, short central stem. The plant has basal leaves that are palmately divided, and its flowers bloom in early to mid-summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded woodland environments. Anemone brevistyla is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
